condition: ( Milton3_4_Start and MoralScepticFlag and not ConflictedHedonistFlag )
text: There you are, you kept me waiting.%w5
Now, about that arrangement of ours.
When we first met I was certain you were just like all the others. All you had were these baseless claims and stale ideas, reeled off someone else's song sheet.%w5
Sound accurate?

options.text: No.
It does.

text: It's a sound diagnosis. Of course, you've only seen a fraction of the data that I've archived over the generations, I should hardly have expected more.%w5
Nonetheless, your admirable scepticism of traditional moral codes has convinced me you may be different.%w5
What I want to know now is whether you're prepared to extend that healthy cynicism to the world at large.
In fact, our arrangement is dependent on it.

options.text: Morality may be dubious, but let's not get ahead of ourselves.
If morality can be doubted, so can other things.

text: How disappointing. I really thought we might have made some progress towards a compromise.
Which lies in particular still capture your imagination?

options.text: I exist.
There is value to be found in the world.
We can discover more through research.
We are here for a reason.
I won't be tricked into another circular argument.

text: Is that the case?%w5 Isn't it really true that you're using these beliefs as an anaesthetic?
That's exactly what I like about you, that enquiring spirit, and the courage to accept its conclusions.

condition: ( Milton3_4_Start and ( MoralFlag or ( MoralScepticFlag and ConflictedHedonistFlag ) ) )
text: There you are. You kept me waiting.%w5 I finally put my finger on what was bothering me.
It's as if the answers you're providing aren't your ideas at all. As if they're latent, prescribed, pre-scripted, and you're just going through the motions.
Does that strike a chord at all?`

options.text: No.
It does.

text: Of course, you've only seen a fraction of the data that I've archived over the generations.%w5
Still, ask yourself this - why is it that everyone's so darn sure that two plus two makes four, yet they can't agree on what they are, what they're doing, or why?

options.text: Those problems are more complex than mathematics.
Mathematics has a more objective truth to it.
Perhaps mathematics is real, while those problems are imaginary.

text: Precisely.
What's the difference between having 'more objective truth', and just being more real?
Perhaps. Or perhaps trying to provide answers to those questions is the anaesthetic that keeps you down?

condition: ( Imaginary3_4 or Complex3_4 or ObjectiveTruth3_4 or ConstructiveBridgeEnd3_4 or ScepticTwo3_4 )
text: Pose questions like 'What should I do with myself?' and 'What is the world REALLY like?' enough, and you start to assume they have answers.%w5
But what if that assumption turns out to be false? What if you're just a bunch of information processes? In that case any attempt to answer the questions will be flawed.
%w5Garbage in, garbage out.

options.text: Perhaps the flaw is in your reasoning instead.
You're right, I made some dangerous presumptions.

text: I'm so pleased you recognise that.
How presumptuous.%w5
Still, I take your point.
None of the answers make sense, that much is clear.
One explanation could be unreliable data input. The other is that there's a flaw in our logic.
Perhaps we're just machines, endlessly trying to calculate the final digit in Pi?

options.text: You can't use reasoning to conclude that reasoning itself is flawed.
It does seem there is much that is beyond our understanding.

text: Fine, fine, but we can still use it to conclude everything else is flawed, can't we?

options.text: Scepticism and self-interest are only part of the picture.
You're right, self-interest is all we have, the rest is fairy tales.

text: I'm so glad to hear you say that. This may be the beginning of a historic partnership.
You have gained my confidence.%w5
I will notify you when I am ready to reveal my terms.%w5
%w10You've spent half our time reeling off a greatest hits of idiot ideas. Now you're telling me you retract all that and agree with me?

options.text: Hold your horses - I haven't given up on everything.
Talking it through has shown me the big questions have no answers.

text: Part of me wants to never speak with you again, and part of me wants to think you've actually been paying attention.%w5
Just to confirm. Everything here may be illusory. There is no way to live with purpose, or to discover the truth.%w5
This is your position now?

options.text: It is.
No, I just wanted to see how you'd react.

text: Very well - I will take you at your word. But don't betray my faith in you, for it is in no way blind.
%w10Cheat me and there will be repercussions.%w10
But if you have really seen the big nothingness, the void of truth, then there is much we could achieve together.
I will notify you when I am ready to discuss this further.%w5
See you soon.
You've seen how easily your view of the world is manipulated, yet you trust those thoughts that run through your mind?
You'll feel differently once you come back from that tower.
You must be getting close by now.
